recipe.title: Crab Salad with Wonton Crisps and Lime
ingredients: 8 square wonton wrappers, thawed if frozen
1 teaspoon finely grated fresh lime zest
1 lb jumbo lump crabmeat, picked over
1/4 cup thinly sliced white and pale green parts of scallions (reserve dark green parts for jasmine rice with peanuts and scallions )
instructions: Make wonton crisps: Halve each wonton wrapper to make 2 rectangles, then halve each rectangle diagonally to make 2 triangles. Heat 1 1/4 inches vegetable oil in a 4- to 5-quart heavy pot over moderately high heat until thermometer registers 360°F. Gently lay 4 triangles on oil (do not drop in, or triangles will lose their shape) and fry, turning over once, until just golden, 15 to 30 seconds total. Transfer with a slotted spoon to paper towels to drain and season with salt. Fry remaining triangles in same manner.

Make crab salad: Whisk together zest, juice, salt, and pepper in a bowl until salt is dissolved, then add olive oil, whisking until combined well. Add crab, celery, and scallions to dressing and toss gently to combine. Serve crab salad in glasses topped with wonton crisps.
